comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)

Not sure if this is a bug or deliberate attempt, when we are reading a document or when the body/document is active after a webpage is opened and clicking F4 key doesn't expand the address list.  F4 expands the address bar only when the focus is on address bar.  In IE, clicking F4, even when the focus is not on the address bar, results in the address bar being expanded.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open www.mozilla.com
2.Just click on any of the empty space in the webpage.
3.Press F4
Actual Results:  
Doesn't expand the address bar to list out the recent addresses (url's).

Expected Results:  
The address bar should have expanded and shown all the recent url's in the address bar.
comments.author: lv.chandrasekhar@gmail.com
comments.creator: lv.chandrasekhar@gmail.com

F4 expands the address bar only when the focus is on address bar.  In IE, clicking F4, even when the focus is not on the address bar, results in the address bar being expanded.

This is okay for me using
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110121 Firefox/3.6.14 and
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de; rv:1.9.2.15pre) Gecko/20110128 Namoroka/3.6.15pre

Is your Issue reproducible Extension-less in Safe-Mode and/or using a new Profile?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing+profiles#Creating_a_profile
